page.title: 17 Fishing on the River Wye.
page.content: The River Wye is one of the most popular salmon fisheries and has a high degree of freshwater fishing.The Wye is stocked full of many freshwater fish,such as trout,chub,pike and many other species .From the Mallybrook to the Rowing Club,there is a lot of competition for salmon,this stretch is now owned by West Glamorgan Anglers. Most of the salmon caught are sold to resteraunts and can bring an average price of 50 pounds.Salmon is a very expensive fish to buy,at about 4.50 per pound. Poaching is a very serious problem, many thousands of salmon are stolen, which is very costly for stockists. A new law has been introduced in 1985 in connection with the prosecution of poachers.By the new law the accused has the onus of proving himself innocent. Fines are often severe.
